servers.description: There is only one api url. Destinction between sandbox and live requests is done by the api key

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page that should be returned

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of items that should be shown on a page (default value is 100)

allOf.description: An address that was created. It is referenced by its id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of a previously created address

get.description: Returns a single address based on its identifier

200.description: Detailed information about a single address

get.description: Returns all carriers for the user associated with the api key

name.description: key for referencing the carrier within shipcloud

display_name.description: name of the carrier you can use to display it in your application

items.description: key for referencing the service within shipcloud
key for referencing the package type within shipcloud
key to identify the additional service

200.description: Detailed information the default returns address
Detailed information the default shipping address

get.description: Getting information about the current user

200.description: Detailed information about the current user that is making the request.

get.description: Get all pickup requests for this user

allOf.description: Pickup request for a one time pickup

carrier.description: acronym of the carrier you want to use

id.description: The identifier of the shipment that should be picked up

get.description: Returns a single pickup request based on the id

200.description: Detailed information about a single pickup request

post.description: Find out how much we will charge you for a specific shipment when using shipcloud carrier contracts.

carrier.description: acronym of the carrier you want to use

service.description: The service that should be used for the shipment.

200.description: Shipment quote for a single shipment

price.description: price that we're going to charge you (exl. VAT)

tracking_events.details: Die Sendung wurde in das Zustellfahrzeug geladen.
Die Sendung wurde im Start-Paketzentrum bearbeitet.

get.description: Returns a single shipment based on the id

200.description: Detailed information about a single shipment

put.description: Updates a single shipment based on the id

200.description: Updated information about a single shipment

delete.description: Deletes a single shipment. **Notice:**  Prepared shipments (where `create_shipping_label` is `false`) can be deleted at any time, because no transaction with the carrier has happened until this point and no actual shipping label has been created. In case you've created a shipping label you can delete it before the cutoff time of the carrier. Cutoff times differ from carrier to carrier and are some time between 5pm and 8pm.

get.description: Get a list of previously created trackers

schema.description: Trackers allow you to monitor a shipment even though it wasn't created using shipcloud

carrier_tracking_no.description: Tracking number (provided by the carrier) of the shipment which should be monitored

carrier.description: acronym of the carrier the shipment was created with

notification_email.description: email address that we should notify once there's an update for this shipment

tracking_events.details: Lieferung hat das Logistikzentrum verlassen und ist unterwegs.
Ihre Sendung wurde zugestellt. Die Sendung wurde zugestellt an Simon Fröhler shipcloud GmbH.

country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

phone.description: telephone number (mandatory when using UPS and the following terms apply: service is one_day or one_day_early or ship to country is different than ship from country)

email.description: email address for this person. Some carrier are using the email address to notify it about a shipment

id.description: identifier of a previously created address

current_user.description: Getting information about the user that is making the request

id.description: The unique identifier for this user (generated by shipcloud).

email.description: The email address associated with this user

customer_no.description: The unique identifier for this customer (generated by shipcloud). Used e.g. in support cases.

environment.description: Shows the corresponding environment for the currently used api key.

plan_name.description: A key to identify the plan the user currently has

plan_display_name.description: Name of the plan the user currently has. Can be used for displaying it at the frontend.

chargeable.description: true if the user did provide a chargeable payment method.

format.description: defines the format that the returned label should have

size.description: defines the size that the returned label should have

height.description: Height of the parcel in cm

length.description: Length of the parcel in cm

weight.description: Weight of the parcel in kg

width.description: Width of the parcel in cm

declared_value.description: Object that is used for booking an additional insurance at the carrier (if applicable)

amount.description: The total amount of the goods value that an additional insurance should be booked for

currency.description: The currency used. Currently onl EUR is applicable

timestamp.description: timestamp of when this event occured

location.description: location of the package at this moment

details.description: message the carrier sends to describe the package status

pickup.description: for some carriers a pickup has to be requested when creating a shipment

pickup_time_object.description: defines a time window in which the carrier should pickup shipments

id.description: shipcloud identifier for this pickup request

carrier.description: carrier used for this pickup request

carrier_pickup_number.description: carrier identifier for this pickup request

id.description: id of the shipment included in this pickup request
shipcloud identifier for this pickup request

carrier.description: carrier used for this pickup request

carrier_pickup_number.description: carrier identifier for this pickup request

id.description: id of the shipment included in this pickup request

carrier.description: acronym of the carrier you want to use

allOf.description: If missing, the default sender address (if defined in your shipcloud account) will be used
Overwrites the sender address on the shipping label

service.description: The service that should be used for the shipment.

reference_number.description: a reference number (max. 30 characters) that you want this shipment to be identified with. You can use this afterwards to easier find the shipment in the shipcloud.io backoffice

description.description: text that describes the contents of the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if you're using UPS and the following conditions are true: from and to countries are not the same; from and/or to countries are not in the EU; from and to countries are in the EU and the shipments service is not 'standard'. The parameter is also mandatory when using DHL Express as carrier.

notification_email.description: email address that we should notify once there's an update for this shipment

name.description: key to identify the additional service

id_type.description: Type of ID document that should be used for verifying a Hermes recipient

language.description: language the customer should be notified in (ISO-639-1 format)

reference1.description: Text that should be displayed as the reason for transfer

contents_explanation.description: description of contents. Mandatory if contents_type is 'commercial_goods. Max 256 characters, when using DHL as your carrier'

additional_fees.description: additional custom fees to be payed

drop_off_location.description: location where the package will be dropped of with the carrier

total_value_amount.description: the overall value of the shipments' contents

origin_country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

hs_tariff_number.description: customs tariff number. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonized_System#Tariffs_by_region for detailed information on region specific tariff numbers

quantity.description: Number that defines how many items of this kind are in the shipment

value_amount.description: The total value for items of this kind

net_weight.description: Total weight for items of this kind

create_shipping_label.description: determines if a shipping label should be created at the carrier (this means you will be charged when using the production api key)

metadata.description: here you can save additional data that you want to be associated with the shipment. Any combination of key-value pairs is possible

carrier_tracking_no.description: the original tracking number that can be used on the carriers website

label_url.description: URL where you can download the label in pdf format

price.description: price that we're going to charge you (exl. VAT)

shipper_notification_email.description: email address of the shipper who should be notified of a change of shipment status by shipcloud

tracking_url.description: URL you can send your customers so they can track this shipment

id.description: the shipment id that can be used for requesting info about a shipment or tracking it

carrier_tracking_no.description: the original tracking number that can be used on the carriers website

tracking_url.description: URL you can send your customers so they can track this shipment

label_url.description: URL where you can download the label in pdf format

price.description: Price that you're going to be charged with (exl. VAT). You will get a price of 0.0 when using the sandbox or your own carrier contracts.

carrier_tracking_no.description: tracking number (provided by the carrier) for this shipment

tracking_status_updated_at.description: timestamp the tracking status was last updated

last_polling_at.description: timestamp the shipment status was last polled at the carrier

next_polling_at.description: timestamp the shipment status will be polled the next time

shipment_id.description: id of the corresponding shipment within shipcloud

carrier.description: acronym of the carrier the shipment was sent with

timestamp.description: timestamp of when this event occured

location.description: location of the package at this moment

details.description: message the carrier sends to describe the shipments status

id.description: the tracker id that can be used for requesting info about a tracker

externalDocs.description: Find more info at the shipcloud developer portal
